gurmukhi: ਭੀਮ ਭਾਤ ਧਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਨਿਸ਼ੰਕ ਘਾੲਿ ਕਰਤ ਅਾੲਿ || ਜੂਝ ਜੂਝ ਕੈ ਮਰੈ ਸੁ ਦੇਵ ਲੋਕ ਬਸਤ ਜਾੲਿ ||੪੦੮||
transliteration: Bheem Bhaat Dhaae Kai Nishank Ghaae Karat Aae|| Joojh Joojh Kai Darai Su Dev Lok Basat Jaae||408||
translation: The brave warriors like Bhima are fearlessly striking blows and after fighting and embracing martyrdom, they are getting abode in the region of gods.408.

gurmukhi: ਤਾਨ ਤਾਨ ਬਾਨ ਕੌ ਅਜਾਨ ਬਾਹ ਧਾਵਹੀ || ਜੂਝ ਜੂਝ ਕੈ ਮਰੈ ਅਲੋਕ ਲੋਕ ਪਾਵਹੀ ||
transliteration: Taan Taan Baan Kau Ajaan Baah Dhaavahi|| Joojh Joojh Kai Darai Alok Lok Paavahi||
translation: Pulling their bows and discharging arrows, they are advancing towards the Lord (Kalki) and embracing martyrdom, they are going to the next world;

gurmukhi: ਰੰਗ ਜੰਗ ਅੰਗ ਨੰਗ ਭੰਗ ਅੰਗਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਪਰਤ || ਟੂਕ ਟੂਕ ਹੋੲਿ ਗਿਰੈ ਸੁ ਦੇਵ ਸੁੰਦ੍ਰੀਨਿ ਬਰਤ ||੪੦੯||
transliteration: Ran Jan An Nan Bhan An(i) Hoe Parat|| Took Took Hoe Girai Su Dev Soundreen(i) Barat||409||
translation: They are absorbed in fighting and are falling into bits before him; these warriors are falling into bits for the sake of heavenly damsels and are embracing death.409.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਿੜਰਿੜ ਤੀਰੰ || ਬ੍ਰਿੜਰਿੜ ਬੀਰੰ || ਢ੍ਰਿੜਰਿੜ ਢੋਲੰ || ਬ੍ਰਿੜਰਿੜ ਬੋਲੰ ||੪੧੦||
transliteration: Trid-rid Tderan|| Breed-rid Bderan|| Dhrid-rid Dholan|| Brir-rid Bolan||410||
translation: The arrows of the warriors are crackling and the drums are rolling.410.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਿੜੜਿੜ ਤਾਜੀ || ਬ੍ਰਿੜੜਿੜ ਬਾਜੀ || ਹ੍ਰਿੜੜਿੜ ਹਾਥੀ || ਸ੍ਰਿੜੜਿੜ ਸਾਥੀ ||੪੧੧||
transliteration: Trid-did Taajee|| Brid-rid Baajee|| Hreed-rid Hathee|| Sreed-rid Saathi||||411||
translation: The horses are neighing and the elephants are trumpeting in groups.411.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਰਿੜੜਿੜ ਬਾਣੰ || ਜ੍ਰਿੜੜਿੜ ਜੁਅਾਣੰ || ਛ੍ਰਿੜੜਿੜ ਛੋਰੈਂ || ਜ੍ਰਿੜੜਿੜ ਜੋਰੈਂ ||੪੧੨||
transliteration: Breed-rid Baanan|| Jreed-rid Juaanan|| Chhreed-rid Chhodhain|| Jreed-rid Jorain||412||
translation: The warriors are discharging arrows forcefully.412.

gurmukhi: ਖਰੜੜ ਖੇਤੰ || ਪਰੜੜ ਪ੍ਰੇਤੰ || ਝੜੜੜ ਨਾਚੈ || ਰੰਗਝੜਿ ਰਾਚੈ ||੪੧੩||
transliteration: Khad-dad Khetan|| Pad-dad Pretan|| Jhad-dad Naachai|| Ran-jhad(i) Raachai||413||
translation: The ghosts intoxicated in the hue of war, are dancing, in the battlefield.413.

gurmukhi: ਹਰਰੜ ਹੂਰੰ || ਗਣਰਣ ਪੂਰੰ || ਕ੍ਰੜ ਕਾਛੀ || ਨਰਰੜ ਨਾਚੀ ||੪੧੪||
transliteration: Har-dad Hooran|| Gad-ran Pooran|| Krar-rad Kaadhhee|| Nar-rad Naachee||414||
translation: The sky is filled with heavenly damsels and they are all dancing.4.14.

gurmukhi: ਤਰਰੜ ਤੇਗੰ || ਜਣਘਣ ਬੇਗੰ || ਚਰਰੜ ਚਮਕੈ || ਝੜਰੜ ਝਮਕੈ ||੪੧੫||
transliteration: Tar--rad Tegadg|| Jan-ghan Begadg|| Char-rad Chamkai|| Jjad-rad Jhamkai||415||
translation: The swords are gleaming quickly and they are striking with clattering sound.415.

gurmukhi: ਜਰਰੜ ਜੋਧੰ || ਕਿਰਰੜ ਕ੍ਰੋਧੰ || ਜੜਰੜ ਜੂਝੈ || ਲ੍ਰੜਰੜ ਲੂਝੈ ||੪੧੬||
transliteration: Jar-rad Jodhan|| Kit-rad Krodhan|| Jad-rad Joojhai|| Lrad-rad Loojhai||416||
translation: The warriors are fighting in anger and are dying.416.

gurmukhi: ਖਰਰੜ ਖੇਤੰ || ਅਰਰੜ ਅਚੇਤੰ || ਬ੍ਰੜਰੜ ਬਾਜੀ || ਗਿਰਵੜ ਗਾਜੀ ||੪੧੭||
transliteration: Khar-rad Khetan|| Ar-rad Abhetan|| Brad-rad Baajee|| Girvad Gadjee||417||
translation: The horses and horse-riders are lying unconscious in the battlefield.417.

gurmukhi: ਗ੍ਰਿੜਰੜ ਗਜਣੰ || ਕ੍ਰਿੜਰੜ ਭਜਣੰ || ਰ੍ਰਿੜਰਿੜ ਰਾਜਾ || ਲਿੜਰਿੜ ਲਾਜਾ ||੪੧੮||
transliteration: Grid-rad Gadanaaag|| Krid-rad Bhajanan|| Rrid-rad Raajaa|| Lid-rad Laajaa||418||
translation: The elephants are running away and in this way, the kings, because of the disgrace of defeat, are feeling ashamed.418.

gurmukhi: ਖਿੜਰਿੜ ਖਾਂਡੇ || ਬ੍ਰਿੜਰਿੜ ਬਾਂਡੇ || ਅ੍ਰੜਰਿੜ ਅੰਗੰ || ਜ੍ਰੜਰਿੜ ਜੰਗੰ ||੪੧੯||
transliteration: Khid-rad Khaande|| Brid-rad Baande|| Arad-rad Anadg|| Jrad-ra Janadg||419||
translation: The large daggers are striking blows on the limbs in the war-arena.419.
